page.title: 12Youth Prison S.Wigston.
page.content: {Mr.Ramsey}came to tell us about the {Young Offenders Centre, }built in 1974.He is a senior prison officer,one of 238 officers in charge of 680 pris- oners.All the inmates are boys aged 14 to 21.They stay there for up to 3 yrs. During the day,the prisoners have to work.They earn about Â£1.60 a week.Some of them are allowed out to help with Community projects.A group of them helped to dig out our swimming pool. { {(Parklands).}In the evening they play snooker,table tennis and watch T.V. Every third evening they are locked up in their cells until 7.30am.Mr.Ramsey keeps his keys and whistle on a long chain. Three prisoners have escaped during the past ten years.{During {the 1980's discipline amongst young {people has become a major social issue {in view of rising violence and crime, {particularly from football hooligans.
